category.name: Networking & Security
category.description: Enable communications in a networked environment

setting.name: Modem VID
setting.description: Vendor Identification Number. Only modems with matching VIDs can communicate with each other. (0x3332 is the factory default, 0x10-0x7FFF is user-settable, 0x8000-0xFFFF is factory-set and read-only.)

setting.name: Hopping Channel
setting.description: Set/Read the channel on which a modem communicates. Separate channel minimize interference between multiple sets of modules operating in the same vicinity.

setting.name: Destination Address
setting.description: Set/Read the destination address of the modem. Only modems with matching addresses communicate with each other.

setting.name: Source Address
setting.description: Set/Read the source address of the modem and configure addressing mode. (When MY = 0xFFFF, DT serves as both source and destination address.)

setting.name: Address Mask
setting.description: Set/Read modem address mask to configure local and global address space.

setting.name: Retries
setting.description: Set/Read maximum number of RF packet delivery attempts. If not zero then the receiving modem must also have RR set to a non-zero value.

setting.name: Delay Slots
setting.description: Set/Read the maximum number of delay slots used for random back-off algorithm after a transmission failure.

setting.name: RF Mode
setting.description: Select/read the RF Mode (Peer-to-peer, Multi-Streaming or Repeater) of the modem.

setting.name: Streaming Limit
setting.description: Set maximum number of continuous bytes transmitted by one modem before forcing a delay that allow other modems to transmit. 0 = disabled.

setting.name: Time before Initialization
setting.description: Set mode that allows RF packets to be received with a shorter RF initializer. Warning: This command is only useful in a limited number of applications. Please see XBee-PRO XSC manual before using.

category.name: Serial Interfacing
category.description: Allows changes to modem interfacing options

setting.name: Interface Data Rate
setting.description: Sets serial interface baud rate and thus sets the rate at which serial data enters into the modem. The modemâ€™s over-the-air baud rate is factory-set and cannot be changed. If serial com port Baud rate is set higher than the fixed over-the-air baud of the modem, flow control (CTS) may need to be observed.

setting.name: Parity
setting.description: Select parity format. Settings 0-4 transfer only 8 bits over the antenna port and generate the parity bit on the RF receiving side. NB=5 actually transfers 9 bits over antenna port.

setting.name: Packetization Threshold
setting.description: Begin channel initialization after receiving RB bytes. If RO parameter is 0, no transmission starts until RB bytes are received.

setting.name: Packetization Timeout
setting.description: Begin channel initialization after inter-character delay of RO. If the RB parameter is 0, this command has no effect.

setting.name: RF Packet Size
setting.description: Set maximum RF packet size.

setting.name: DI2 Configuration
setting.description: Select response to Digital Input 2 (/CMD signal - pin 16 of module).

setting.name: DO2 Configuration
setting.description: Select behavior of Digital Output 2 (CTS signal is pin 12 of module).

setting.name: DO3 Configuration
setting.description: Select behavior of Digital Output 3 (RX LED signal - pin 4 of module).

setting.name: Software Flow Control
setting.description: Select hardware or software flow control for CTS and/or RTS functions (see CS and RT parameters).

setting.name: Flow Control Threshold
setting.description: Set/read the flow control threshold. De-assert CTS and/or send XOFF when FT bytes are in the UART receive buffer.

setting.name: Stop Bits
setting.description: Select number of stop bits used for UART communications.

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: Reads modem firmware version number

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: Reads modem hardware version number

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: Read High 16 bits of unique serial number of module.

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: Read Low 16 bits of unique serial number of module.

setting.name: RSSI PWM Timer
setting.description: Enable a PWM (pulse width modulation) output on the config pin (pin 6 of the module) which shows signal strength of RF packets.

setting.name: RSSI
setting.description: Read the signal level of last good packet received

setting.name: Receive Error Count
setting.description: Read number of RF packets detected by the receiver but not sent out of module due to bit errors

setting.name: Receive Good Count
setting.description: Read number of RF packets successfully received.

setting.name: Transmit Error Count
setting.description: Read number of RF packets sent with no ACK received (when RR>0)

setting.name: DI Buffer Size
setting.description: Reads the size of the DI Buffer (UART Receive)

category.name: Command Mode Options
category.description: Commands that change AT command mode behavior

setting.name: Guard Time Before
setting.description: Set required period of silence before the Command Mode Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (BT + CC + AT). The period of silence is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: Select character to be used to break from data mode to command mode.The default value <2BH> is equal to the plus sign <+> in ASCII.

setting.name: Guard Time After
setting.description: Set required period of silence after the Command Mode Characters of the AT Command Mode Sequence (BT + CC + AT). The period of silence is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: If no valid commands have been received within this time period, modem returns to Idle Mode from AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Power-up Mode
setting.description: Select initial mode of operation after power-up, reset or wake from pin sleep.

setting.name: Power Level
setting.description: Select/Read transmitter output power. Approximate power levels are: +7dBm, +15dBm, +18dBm, +21dBm, and +24dBm.

category.name: Sleep (Low Power)
category.description: Configure Sleep Modes to reduce the amount of power consumed by modem

setting.name: Sleep Mode
setting.description: Specifies Sleep Mode settings.

setting.name: Time before Sleep
setting.description: Time-to-Sleep â€“ Sets time of inactivity before entering Sleep Mode - Only valid with Cyclic and Serial Port Sleep settings.

setting.name: Time before Wake-up Initializer
setting.description: Sets time of inactivity, no serial or over-the-air data is sent or received, before a beacon is used. Value should be shorter than time set with LH Command.

setting.name: Wake-up Initializer Timer
setting.description: Specifies the length of the beacon. The length of the beacon should be longer than the interval if time set using HT Command.

setting.name: Pin Wake-up
setting.description: Allow pin wake up from Cyclic Sleep Mode
